name: 2,4,6-trimethylbenzyl alcohol
Reason: 2,4,6-trimethylbenzyl alcohol has a melting point that we can predict by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. (2) The three methyl groups (–CH3) add approximately +10 degrees Celsius each due to increasing molecular weight and rigidity. (3) The benzyl group (Cc1cc(c(c1)C)CO) introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. (4) The methyl groups within the benzyl group can participate in hydrogen bonding, which might lower the melting point by approximately -10 degrees Celsius. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
